keyTakeAways: The NBA season opens with a record 135 players born outside the U.S., from 43 countries, marking a significant global expansion of the league.
Europe has the highest number of international players in the NBA, with 71 from Europe — the most ever from that continent.
Canada leads in non-U.S. players with 23, followed by France (19) and Australia (13).
The Atlanta Hawks open with 10 international players, tying an NBA record.
All 30 NBA teams have at least one international player on their opening night rosters.
The NBA and FIBA are in talks to develop a new European league, potentially launching as early as 2027.
The last seven NBA MVPs have been awarded to players born outside the U.S., the longest such streak in league history.
Players from Serbia (Nikola Jokic), Greece (Giannis Antetokounmpo), Cameroon (Joel Embiid) and Canada (Shai Gilgeous-Alexander) have won the MVP award in the past seven years.
LeBron James is on track to reach 23 seasons, breaking a tie with Vince Carter for most seasons in NBA history, and is approaching records for points, minutes, field goals, and career milestones.
The Brooklyn Nets have the youngest roster in the league, with no players in the top 100 active scorers, and their total career points and starts are significantly lower than elite players.
There are multiple players with common first names like 'Jordan' and 'Nikola' and 'James' in the league, reflecting naming trends and cultural influence.
Orlando Robinson is the only player with his first name on the front and last name on the back of his jersey, highlighting unique personal branding in the league.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The opening of the 2025 NBA season highlights a significant global shift in the league, with a record 135 players born outside the U.S. from 43 countries, including 71 from Europe. This marks a turning point in the NBA's internationalization, as the league and FIBA discuss launching a new European league as early as 2027. Canada leads in non-U.S. players, with 23, followed by France and Australia. The Atlanta Hawks tie an NBA record with 10 international players. The last seven NBA MVPs have gone to players born outside the U.S., underscoring a trend toward global excellence. Meanwhile, the Brooklyn Nets are noted as one of the youngest rosters in the league, while LeBron James continues to break records. The article also highlights cultural and naming trends, such as multiple players named Jordan, Nikola, and James, and individual cases like Orlando Robinson wearing his first name on the front of his jersey. The league is also approaching a milestone with the 14 millionth point in history expected to be scored by late November 2025.
title: NBA Season Opens with Record International Players, Global Expansion in Focus
